title: LLM Dataset Processor
description: Choose specific dataset to process, select LLM, provide API token and craft your prompt template. We recommend to test your prompt first by enabling `Test Prompt Mode`.

inputDatasetId.title: Input Dataset ID
inputDatasetId.description: The ID of the dataset to process.

model.title: Large Language Model
model.description: The LLM to use for processing. Each model has different capabilities and pricing. GPT-4o-mini and Claude 3.5 Haiku are recommended for cost-effective processing, while models like Claude 3 Opus or GPT-4o offer higher quality but at a higher cost.

llmApiToken.title: LLM Provider API Token
llmApiToken.description: Your API token for the LLM Provider (e.g., OpenAI).

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Sampling temperature for the LLM API (controls randomness). We recommend to use a value closer to 0 for exact results. In case of more 'creative' results, we recommend to use a value closer to 1.

multipleColumns.title: Multiple columns in output
multipleColumns.description: When enabled, instructs the LLM to return responses as JSON objects, creating multiple columns in the output dataset. The columns need to be named and described in the prompt. If disabled, responses are stored in a single `llmresponse` column.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description:
The prompt template to send to the LLM API. 

Use `{{fieldName}}` placeholders to insert values from the input dataset (e.g., `Summarize this text: {{content.text}}`). For multiple columns output, ensure your prompt contains the names and descriptions of the desired columns in output.

 See README for more details.

skipItemIfEmpty.title: Skip item if one or more {{fields}} are empty
skipItemIfEmpty.description: When enabled, items will be skipped if any {{field}} referenced in the prompt is empty, null, undefined, or contains only whitespace. This helps prevent processing incomplete data.

maxTokens.title: Max Tokens
maxTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens in the LLM API response.

testPrompt.title: Test Prompt Mode
testPrompt.description: Test mode that processes only a limited number of items (defined by `testItemsCount`). Use this to validate your prompt and configuration before running on the full dataset. We highly recommend enabling this option first to validate your prompt because of ambiguity of the LLM responses.

testItemsCount.title: Test Items Count
testItemsCount.description: Number of items to process when `Test Prompt Mode` is enabled.
